chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Solicit, Direct, Use Another Person to Purchase Pseudoephedrine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Shandon J Tallier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Purchase More Than 7.5 Grams of Pseudoephedrine Product within 30-day Period, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3j).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
231 days credit only if revoked.

Follow all general rules of probation.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol.

Defendant may not enter any bars, taverns or similar class B establishments that serve alcohol, including ber tents. 

Defendant may not injest or consume any illegal drugs or purchase or possess any psuedonephrine except with a valid prescription.

Defendant must take all prescribed medications and only in the manner in which they are prescribed to him.

The defendant must submit a DNA sample with surcharge assessed.

The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

Defendant must continue with AODA treatment plan. 

Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Shandon J Tallier in court with attorney David V. Penn.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:09 PM. State - resolved. Penn provides court with plea questionnaire. Court  has plea questionnaire and it looks like count #3 will be amended to 961.4(3)(j). State - amend count #3, dismiss and read in remaining counts (#1, #2 and #4), joint recommendation of: withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years with conditions of: 30 days in FC jail - huber allowed - allow 30 days to begin sentence, continue with AODA treatment plan, absolute sobriety, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars, taverns or similar establishments that serve alcohol, employment/school, take any prescribed medications and only in the manner in whcih they are prescribed to him, not to injest or consume any illegal drugs, no purchase of psuedofredrine without a valid prescription for him, 231 days credit if revoked. Penn and Tallier agree. State gives new penalties for amended count. Court - looks as if the defendant will be pleading NC to amended count #3. Penn and State agree. Court amends count #3 to the purchase of pseudfedrine contrary to 961.4(3)(j). Court dismisses and reads in counts #1, #2 and #4. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Penn makes final argument prior to sentencing - provides court with documentation of defendant's completed courses - follow joint recommendation - costs and surcharges plus service fees. Tallier withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #3 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years with conditions of: 30 days in FC jail - huber allowed - report by 8:00 AM to FC jail on or before 10/21/15 - credit for 231 days only if revoked, follow all general rules of probation, AODA and follow thru, continue with AODA treatment plan, maintain absolute sobriety, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars, taverns or similar class B establishments that serve alcohol, including beer tents, employment/school, take all, prescribed medications and only in the manner in which they are prescribed to him, not to injest or consume any illegal drugs, no purchase or possession of psuedonephrine except with a valid prescription for him by a physician, costs - take bond posted - refund remainder to poster, service fees - take bond posted, submit DNA sample with surcharge, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, right to appeal.

Telephone conference on November 19, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Shandon J Tallier in court/custody with attorney David V. Penn.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 11:44 am. Officer Tom Robinson called and direct by state (11:45 am). Penn object - court restate 11:57 am. Penn cross (12 pm) Penn offers ex #1 (information from drug.com) 12:15 pm. State objects for stated reasons not relevant. Court asks defense what is relevance of document. Penn responds with relevance of document. State responds to Penn statements. Penn asking for no finding of probable cause on counts 1 & 4. State still believes not relevant. Court addresses ex #1 (disallow exhibit for stated reasons and for the purposes of preliminary hearing). (12:25 pm). Penn continues questionning witness (12:27 pm). State will stipulate that all products found can be used for other things) court accepts stipulation of the parties. State objects (relevance) court allowed (12:30 pm). State re-direct 12:31 pm. Record reflect proper identification of defendant 12:32 pm. Penn objection (lack of foundation) court allows (12:34 pm). Penn re-cross (12:34 pm). Witness excused 12:35 pm.  Penn asks for dimsissal for stated reasons of all counts. State asks for finding of probable cause and to bind over. Court finds probable cause and binds over. State files INFO (mirrors) will proceed to ARGN. Parties have information waive reading, enter NG pleas to all counts. Penn probation offering ATR in Milwaukee facility that is locked facility believes that it is 84 business days (4 months attorney believes) for which he is on hold for at this time. State wants telephonic status conference with Judge to know if/when treatment will be completed and if treatment will be completed. Set for status w/in 60 days all parties to contact Judge's JA in Shawano County. Adj 12:50 pm.

Preliminary hearing on September 26, 2014 at 11:30 am.

Called at 1:17 PM. Shandon Tallier does not appear and his attorney David Penn appears telephonically. State appears by Charles Simono. State - here on the record regarding the motion that the State filed this AM to adjourn the PH that was set for this afternoon. Penn makes statement regarding cancelling the PH that was on this afternoon - argues for a bond modification also (Alternative to Revocation) - would like state's position on bond modification and set for another PH after 9/19/14 for stated reasons. Court asks Penn how he would like the bond to be modified. Penn - add provision that if the defendant cannot post the cash bond, give the defendant the right to leave the jail for one purpose only and that being to enter and complete a 90-120 day prison based institutional AODA program and transportation to such facility to be facilitated by either Department of Corrections or law enforcement only. State has no objections to that bond modification. Court will approve the bond modification as stated by Penn. Penn will waive time limits for PH. Court continues cash bond with new conditions and sets this matter for another PH on 9/26/14 at 11:30 AM.
Motion and Order for Adjourment - approved
and Certificate of Appearance - Sergeant SA
Preliminary hearing on August 19, 2014 at 04:00 pm.
No consumption of alcohol. Defendant must not leave the state of WI without the consent of the court.

Defendant Shandon J Tallier in court/custody via video  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin via phone. Discussion off record regarding counsel not being present. Tallier indicates that his attorney is here was just at jail with him. Counsel David Penn appears in person on behalf of Shandon Tallier. Penn has complaint and has gone over with his client and asks that court provide copy of complaint to defendant. State will see to it that he gets complaint. Penn wants to be heard on bond. Penn questions how bond was set. State responds and court reviews file. State regarding bond - asks bond increased to $10,000. Penn statement to bond asks for $1000 cash and consider ATR of probation and if he can't post it and if ATR is offered that he could go to treatment. State would have no problem with that once the ATR is decided. Court responds will not increase bond as on probation hold. Continue bond - amend conditions not to leave state of WI without courts permission. Tallier would like PH as soon as possible.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2014 at 04:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 31, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
